abstract.text: During the last few years, new experimental and theoretical results have allowed evermore stringent tests of the Standard Model to be performed using kaon decays.
This overview of recent progress includes an updated evaluation of the CKM matrix element V us .
Tests of CKM unitarity and gauge universality and lepton universality tests with K l2 and K l3 decays are discussed.

body_text.text: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

If the couplings of the W to quarks and leptons are indeed specified by a single gauge coupling, then for universality to be observed as the equivalence of the Fermi constant G F as measured in muon and hadron decays, the CKM matrix must be unitary.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: Currently, the most stringent test of CKM unitarity is obtained from the first-row relation |V ud | 2 +|V us | 2 +|V ub | 2 = 1+∆ CKM .
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: During the period spanning 2003 to 2010, a wealth of new measurements of K ℓ3 and K ℓ2 decays and steady theoretical progress made possible precision tests of the Standard Model (SM) based on this relation.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: In a 2010 evaluation of |V us |, the FlaviaNet Working Group on Kaon Decays set bounds on ∆ CKM at the level of 0.1% [1], which translate into bounds on the effective scale of new physics on the order of 10 TeV [15].
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: Since 2010, there have been a few significant new measurements and some important theoretical developments.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: Among the latter, advances in algorithmic sophistication and computing power are leading to more and better lattice QCD estimates of the hadronic constants f + (0) and f K / f π , which enter into the determination of |V us | from K ℓ3 and K µ2 decays, respectively.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: In addition, two groups working on the classification and averaging of results from lattice QCD [2,3] have joined their efforts, forming the newly formed Flavor Lattice Average Group (FLAG-2) to provide recommended values of these constants [11].
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: The experimental inputs for the determination of |V us | from K ℓ3 decays are the rates and form factors for the decays of both charged and neutral kaons.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: There have been no new branching ratio (BR) measurements since the 2010 review.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: On the other hand, both the KLOE and KTeV collaborations have new measurements of the K S lifetime, τ K S .
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: The KLOE measurement [4] is based on the vertex distribution for K S → π + π − decays in e + e − → φ → K S K L events.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: The new KTeV result [5] comes from a comprehensive reanalysis of the ππ vertex distributions in the experiment's regenerator beam.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: This analysis can be performed with or without assuming CPT symmetry.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: The present update makes use of the new KTeV values for τ K S and Re ε ′ /ε (which enters the fit for the K L rates by providing an effective measurement of BR(π 0 π 0 )/BR(π + π − )) obtained without the CPT assumption.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: The largest effect of these updates is to reduce the uncertainty on τ K S , the value of which changes from 89.59(6) ps [1] to 89.58(4) ps.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: The NA48/2 experiment has recently released preliminary results for the form factors for both K ± e3 and K ± µ3 decays [6].
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: At the moment, the fits are performed using one of two parameterizations,
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: • polynomial:
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: The FlaviaNet Working Group uses the dispersive parameterizations of [7] because of the advantages described in [1].
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: NA48/2 has not yet performed dispersive fits.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: However, it is possible to fit approximately equivalent values of Λ + and lnC to the NA48/2 measurements of (λ ′ + , λ ′′ + , λ 0 ) using the expressions in the appendix of [7] and the observation that λ 0 ≈ λ ′ 0 + 3.5λ ′′ 0 [8].
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: This is important because it helps to resolve a controversy: the older measurements of the K µ3 form factors for K L decays from NA48 [9] are in such strong disagreement with the other existing measurements that they have been excluded from the FlaviaNet averages [1].
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: The new NA48/2 measurements, on the other hand, are in good agreement with other measurements, as seen from Fig. 1.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: Including the new NA48/2 results, appropriately converted for the current purposes, the dispersive average becomes Λ + = (25.75 ± 0.36) × 10 −3 , lnC = 0.1895(70), with ρ = −0.202 and P(χ 2 ) = 55%.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: The central values of the phase space integrals barely change with this inclusion; the uncertainties are reduced by 30%.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: For all of the above efforts, however, the value of and uncertainty on |V us | f + (0) is essentially unchanged.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: This is because the new results are nicely consistent with the older averages, and neither the K S lifetime nor the phase space integrals were significant contributors to the overall experimental uncertainty.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: The updated five-channel (
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: ) average is |V us | f + (0) = 0.2163(5) with P(χ 2 ) = 93%.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: The ratio of the values for |V us f + (0)| 2 obtained from K µ3 and K e3 decays is 1.002 (5).
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: This ratio is proportional to (g µ /g e ) 2 ; the result confirms the universality of lepton couplings.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: Comparison of the results obtained with K + and K L , K S decays confirms the accuracy of the correction for strong isospin breaking ∆ SU (2) .
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: The correction used in the analysis is ∆ SU(2) = (2.9 ± 0.4)% [10], while perfect equality of the experimental results would require ∆ SU(2) = (2.73 ± 0.41)%.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: The uncertainty on the theoretical value is one of the largest contributions to the uncertainty on |V us | f + (0) from K ± decays.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: The currently recommended FLAG-2 value [11] for f + (0) from three-flavor lattice QCD is that obtained by RBC/UKQCD [12].
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: For the present analysis, the uncertainty is symmetrized, giving f + (0) = 0.959 (5) and thus |V us | = 0.2254 (13).
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: Importantly, the test of CKM unitarity also requires a value for |V ud |.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: The most recent definitive survey of experimental data on 0 + → 0 + β decays is that of [13], which gives |V ud | = 0.97425 (22).
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: This, together with the value of |V us | from K ℓ3 , yields ∆ CKM = 0.0000 (8), demonstrating perfect agreement with unitarity.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: Up to kinematic factors and radiative corrections, the ratio of the (innerbremsstrahlung inclusive) rates for K µ2 and π µ2 decays provides the quantity
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: The FlaviaNet fit for the K ± BRs, which provides the values for BR(K ± µ2 ) and τ K ± , is unchanged since the 2010 review.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: There are some important changes in the theoretical inputs.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: The most recent FLAG-2 average of the four complete and published determinations of f K / f π in three-flavor lattice QCD is f K / f π = 1.193(5) [11], only slightly changed from the situation in 2010 by the addition of a single study.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: More significant is a new calculation of the corrections to the ratio Γ(K ± µ2 )/Γ(π ± µ2 ) for isospin breaking [14], which for the first time takes into account the effects of strong isosping breaking, in addition to the long-distance electromagnetic corrections.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: While the magnitude of the total correction is nearly doubled, the contribution to the uncertainty from the correction is increased by only about 20%.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: The resulting value for |V us /V ud | is 0.2317 (11).
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: The values of |V ud | from 0 + → 0 + β decays, |V us | from K ℓ3 decays, and |V us /V ud | from K µ2 decays can be combined in a single fit to increase the sensitivity of the unitarity test.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: The unconstrained fit does not change the input value of |V ud | and gives |V us | = 0.2256 (8).
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: This gives ∆ CKM = +0.0001(6), once again in perfect agreement with unitarity.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: Using a model-indepenent, effective-theory approach, the authors of [15] show that the effective scale for corresponding contributions from new physics with approximate flavor symmetry is about 10 TeV.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: The corresponding results in 2010 were |V us | = 0.2253 (9) and ∆ CKM = −0.0001(6) [1].
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: The new measurements of τ K S and the K ℓ3 form factor parameters have virtually no effect on the final result.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: While there is a small effect from the inclusion of the new lattice estimate for f K / f π in the FLAG-2 average, the largest single influence is from the new correction to the ratio Γ(K µ2 )/Γ(π µ2 ) for the effects of strong isospin breaking.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: This underscores a simple fact: so much work has been done to increase the precision of the experimental inputs to |V us | that, for the moment at least, further experimental progress is difficult.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: The measurements that offer the most room for improvement are the BRs for the K ℓ3 decays of the K S and of the K ± , and in the case of K ± , to be useful, better BR measurements would also require a more precise theoretical estimate for ∆ SU (2) .
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: But while the experimental quantities |V us | f + (0) and |V us /V ud | × f K / f π have been measured to within about 0.2%, the precision of the unitarity test is currently determined by the uncertainties on the lattice results for f + (0) and f K / f π , which are at the level of 0.5%.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: Thus, at the moment, the lattice offers the most certain prospects for further improvement.
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: Results for f + (0) and f K / f π with precison at the level of 0.2% may be available as early as 2014, and continued progess is expected thereafter [16].
body_text.section: V us FROM K ℓ3 AND K ℓ2 DECAYS; RELATED TESTS

body_text.text: K ℓ2 DECAYS AND LEPTON UNIVERSALITY
The K e2 decay (K → eν) is strongly helicity suppressed.
body_text.section: K ℓ2 DECAYS AND LEPTON UNIVERSALITY

body_text.text: The ratio R K of the widths (inclusive of internal bremsstrahlung) for K e2 to K µ2 decays depends only on kinematic factors and radiative corrections-the form factor f K cancels from the ratio, and the uncertainty on the expected value is very small: R K = 2.477(1) × 10 −5 [17].
body_text.section: K ℓ2 DECAYS AND LEPTON UNIVERSALITY

body_text.text: These features-a BR suppressed in the SM and a precisely known SM rate-make the decay interesting in the precision-based search for evidence of new physics.
body_text.section: K ℓ2 DECAYS AND LEPTON UNIVERSALITY

body_text.text: A specific motivation for new measurements of R K is that in the Minimal Supersymmetric Standard Model (MSSM) with R parity, there may be a percent-level contribution to the K e2 rate from the H + -mediated amplitude with lepton-flavor violation in the one-loop effective coupling at the H + → e + ν vertex (i.e., with ν = ν τ ), depending on the values of tan β , m H + ,and the mass insertion |∆ 31 R | in the loop [18].
body_text.section: K ℓ2 DECAYS AND LEPTON UNIVERSALITY

body_text.text: The first modern measurement of R K was performed with the KLOE experiment [19].
body_text.section: K ℓ2 DECAYS AND LEPTON UNIVERSALITY

body_text.text: The K ± → e ± decay vertices were reconstructed in the drift chamber with tight quality cuts.
body_text.section: K ℓ2 DECAYS AND LEPTON UNIVERSALITY

body_text.text: The event selection was refined using the missing mass at the vertex (M 2 ℓ = m 2 ν = 0 for signal events) and a neural network for e/µ separation in the electromagnetic calorimeter.
body_text.section: K ℓ2 DECAYS AND LEPTON UNIVERSALITY

body_text.text: The event counting was performed by a two-dimensional likelihood fit in the plane of M 2 ℓ vs. the neural network output.
body_text.section: K ℓ2 DECAYS AND LEPTON UNIVERSALITY

body_text.text: On the basis of about 14k events, KLOE measured R K = 2.493(25) stat (19) syst , i.e., with an uncertainty of about 1.2%.
body_text.section: K ℓ2 DECAYS AND LEPTON UNIVERSALITY

body_text.text: KLOE was also able to isolate K e2γ events with structure-dependent (SD+) radiation well enough to fit the E γ spectrum to determine the parameters for the O(p 4 ) chiral-perturbation-theory representation of the form factor.
body_text.section: K ℓ2 DECAYS AND LEPTON UNIVERSALITY

body_text.text: The NA62 experiment, a successor to NA48 the goal of which is to measure the rare K + → π + νν decay, benefits from much higher statistics from the 75-GeV kaon beam and easier e/µ separation at high energies with the NA48 liquid krypton calorimeter (LKr).
body_text.section: K ℓ2 DECAYS AND LEPTON UNIVERSALITY

body_text.text: In 2007, NA62 collected nearly 150k K e2 decays in a dedicated run.
body_text.section: K ℓ2 DECAYS AND LEPTON UNIVERSALITY

body_text.text: For the analysis, a cut on the E/p ratio for decay tracks (with E measured in the LKr and p reconstructed in the dipole spectrometer) provides µ rejection at the level of 10 −6 .
body_text.section: K ℓ2 DECAYS AND LEPTON UNIVERSALITY

body_text.text: The probability for muons to lose enough energy in the LKr via catastrophic bremsstrahlung to be mistaken for electrons is estimated using data from runs in which part of the LKr acceptance was blocked to electrons with a thick lead shield.
body_text.section: K ℓ2 DECAYS AND LEPTON UNIVERSALITY

body_text.text: Event counting is performed by fitting the M 2 ℓ distributions.
body_text.section: K ℓ2 DECAYS AND LEPTON UNIVERSALITY

body_text.text: In 2011, NA62 published a result based on a 40% subsample of the data collected: R K = 2.487(13) × 10 −5 [20].
body_text.section: K ℓ2 DECAYS AND LEPTON UNIVERSALITY

body_text.text: The full sample has now been analyzed and the final result made public: R K = 2.488(7) stat (7) syst × 10 −5 [21].
body_text.section: K ℓ2 DECAYS AND LEPTON UNIVERSALITY

body_text.text: This result has 0.4% precision and is in agreement with the SM prediction.
body_text.section: K ℓ2 DECAYS AND LEPTON UNIVERSALITY

body_text.text: For the subtraction of the background from the SD+ component of the radiative channel K e2γ , the NA62 measurement makes use of the KLOE measurement mentioned above.
body_text.section: K ℓ2 DECAYS AND LEPTON UNIVERSALITY

body_text.text: NA62 has performed its own measurement of the SD+ component in the works and preliminary results have been shown [22].
body_text.section: K ℓ2 DECAYS AND LEPTON UNIVERSALITY

body_text.text: The new NA62 result essentially determines the new world average: R K = 2.488(9) × 10 −5 .
body_text.section: K ℓ2 DECAYS AND LEPTON UNIVERSALITY
